events.name: EU battery supply chain sustainability and security
events.wd_label: EU battery supply chain sustainability and security
events.wd_description: The EU aims to ensure a sustainable and secure supply of raw materials for battery manufacturing to remain competitive in the global market, necessitating reliable information and systemic analysis.
events.description: The EU aims to ensure a sustainable and secure supply of raw materials for battery manufacturing to remain competitive in the global market, necessitating reliable information and systemic analysis.

events.name: Material System Analysis (MSA)
events.wd_description: MSA studies provide crucial information for sustainable resource management, focusing on five key battery materials: cobalt, lithium, manganese, natural graphite, and nickel.
events.description: MSA studies provide crucial information for sustainable resource management, focusing on five key battery materials: cobalt, lithium, manganese, natural graphite, and nickel.

events.name: MSA results for 2016
events.wd_description: The report presents MSA results for the year 2016, summarizing material stocks and flows for five selected battery materials.
events.description: The report presents MSA results for the year 2016, summarizing material stocks and flows for five selected battery materials.

events.name: Data sources and harmonization
events.wd_description: Priority was given to official and publicly available data sources, harmonized with the latest available datasets from the ProSum database.
events.description: Priority was given to official and publicly available data sources, harmonized with the latest available datasets from the ProSum database.

events.name: Self-sufficiency analysis
events.wd_description: The EU's self-sufficiency for battery materials was analyzed separately for extraction and manufacturing stages, revealing significant reliance on imports.
events.description: The EU's self-sufficiency for battery materials was analyzed separately for extraction and manufacturing stages, revealing significant reliance on imports.

events.name: Extraction stage
events.wd_description: Analysis of self-sufficiency in the extraction stage showed low EU self-sufficiency for natural graphite and higher for nickel in 2016.
events.description: Analysis of self-sufficiency in the extraction stage showed low EU self-sufficiency for natural graphite and higher for nickel in 2016.

events.name: Manufacturing stage
events.wd_description: Analysis of the manufacturing stage indicated that the EU was more self-sufficient in producing products containing cobalt and lithium compared to other materials in 2016.
events.description: Analysis of the manufacturing stage indicated that the EU was more self-sufficient in producing products containing cobalt and lithium compared to other materials in 2016.

events.name: Recycling and dependency
events.wd_description: The report highlights the low functional recycling rates of battery materials in the EU and the continued dependency on primary materials.
events.description: The report highlights the low functional recycling rates of battery materials in the EU and the continued dependency on primary materials.

events.name: End-of-life recycling input rate (EOL-RIR)
events.wd_description: Cobalt had the highest EOL-RIR at 22%, while lithium's recycling rate was close to 0%, indicating limited progress in recycling.
events.description: Cobalt had the highest EOL-RIR at 22%, while lithium's recycling rate was close to 0%, indicating limited progress in recycling.

events.name: Dependency on primary materials
events.wd_description: The EU remains highly dependent on imports of primary materials for battery production, despite recycling efforts.
events.description: The EU remains highly dependent on imports of primary materials for battery production, despite recycling efforts.

events.name: Future demand and imports
events.wd_description: The demand for battery materials is expected to increase significantly, leading to intensified imports and a need for increased EU production capacity.
events.description: The demand for battery materials is expected to increase significantly, leading to intensified imports and a need for increased EU production capacity.

events.name: Future demand projections
events.wd_description: Strong promotion of clean technologies is expected to multiply the demand for battery materials in the coming years.
events.description: Strong promotion of clean technologies is expected to multiply the demand for battery materials in the coming years.

events.name: Increased imports
events.wd_description: The increasing demand will likely intensify imports of battery materials into the EU.
events.description: The increasing demand will likely intensify imports of battery materials into the EU.

events.name: EU production capacity
events.wd_description: Expansion of the EU's production capacity for batteries and related products will be crucial for the region's competitiveness in the global market.
events.description: Expansion of the EU's production capacity for batteries and related products will be crucial for the region's competitiveness in the global market.
